cite: Ahn, W. Y., Busemeyer, J. R., & Wagenmakers, E. J. (2008). Comparison of decision learning models using the generalization criterion method. Cognitive Science, 32(8), 1376-1402. http://doi.org/10.1080/03640210802352992

Worthy, D. A., & Todd Maddox, W. (2013). A comparison model of reinforcement-learning and win-stay-lose-shift decision-making processes: A tribute to W.K. Estes. Journal of Mathematical Psychology, 59, 41-49. http://doi.org/10.1016/j.jmp.2013.10.001

data_columns.subjID: A unique identifier for each subject in the data-set.
data_columns.choice: Integer indicating which deck was chosen on that trial (where A==1, B==2, C==3, and D==4).
data_columns.gain: Floating point value representing the amount of currency won on that trial (e.g. 50, 100).
data_columns.loss: Floating point value representing the amount of currency lost on that trial (e.g. 0, -50).

additional_args.desc: Raw payoffs within data are divided by this number. Used for scaling data. Defaults to 100.
